text: He who loves discipline loves knowledge,
but he who hates rebuke \add is\add* stupid.
The good obtains favor from Yahweh,
but anyone who schemes, he condemns.
A person will not be established by wickedness,
but the root of the righteous will not be moved.
A woman of strength\f + \fr 12:4 \ft Or “honor” \f* \add is\add* the crown of her master,\f + \fr 12:4 \ft Or “lord, owner” \f*
but like rot in his bones is she who brings shame.
The thoughts of the righteous are\f + \fr 12:5 \ft Hebrew “is” \f* just;
the advice of the wicked is treacherous.
The words of the wicked \add are\add* an ambush of blood,
but the mouth of the upright delivers them.
The wicked are overthrown and ⸤are no more⸥,\f + \fr 12:7 \ft Literally “there is no them” \f*
but the house of the righteous shall stand.
For his mouth of good sense, a man will be recommended,
but he who is of perverse ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 12:8 \ft Literally “heart” \f* will be despised.
It is better to be lowly and a servant ⸤to someone⸥\f + \fr 12:9 \ft Literally “for him,” “\fq belonging \ft to him” \f*
than self-glorifying and lacking food.
The righteous knows the life\f + \fr 12:10 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* of his animal,
but the compassion\f + \fr 12:10 \ft Hebrew “compassions” \f* of the wicked is cruel.
He who works his land will have plenty of food,
but he who follows worthless things lacks ⸤sense⸥.\f + \fr 12:11 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
The wicked covets the proceeds of evil,
but the root of the righteous ⸤bears fruit⸥.\f + \fr 12:12 \ft Literally “gives, sets up” \f*
By the transgression of lips, evil is ensnared,
but the righteous escapes from trouble.
From the fruit of the mouth of a man, he is filled with good,
and the reward of ⸤a man’s labor⸥\f + \fr 12:14 \ft Literally “the hands of a man” \f* will return to him.
The way of a fool is upright in his \add own\add* eyes,
but he who listens to advice \add is\add* wise.
As for a fool, ⸤on that very day⸥\f + \fr 12:16 \ft Literally “on the day” \f* he makes his anger known,
but he who ignores an insult \add is\add* prudent.
He who will speak truth will reveal righteousness,
but the witness of falsehood, deceit.
There is one who speaks rashly, like the thrust of a sword,
but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
A lip of truth endures forever,
but a tongue of deception lasts only a moment.
Deceit \add is\add* in the heart\f + \fr 12:20 \ft Or “mind” \f* of ⸤those who plan⸥\f + \fr 12:20 \ft Literally “the planners of” \f* evil,
but to ⸤those who plan⸥\f + \fr 12:20 \ft Literally “the planners of” \f* peace, \add there is\add* joy.
⸤No evil will happen⸥\f + \fr 12:21 \ft Literally “All evil will not happen” \f* to the righteous,
but the wicked are filled \add with\add* trouble.
An abomination of Yahweh are lips of deceit,
but they who act faithfully \add are\add* his delight.
A clever person conceals knowledge,
but the heart\f + \fr 12:23 \ft Or “mind” \f* of a fool\f + \fr 12:23 \ft Hebrew “fools” \f* announces folly.
The hand of the diligent ones will rule,
but the lazy will belong to forced labor.
Anxiety in the heart\f + \fr 12:25 \ft Or “mind” \f* of a man will weigh him down,
but a good word will cheer him.
A righteous person will seek out his neighbor,
but the way of the wicked will lead them astray.
The lazy will not roast his game,
but diligence is the precious wealth of a man.
On the road of righteousness is life,
and \add on\add* the way of the path, \add may there be\add* no death.
